intro: Celastrus orbiculatus var. aureoarillatus, commonly known as the golden aril honeysuckle, is a variant of the common Chinese lantern plant. It is characterized by its striking yellow arils that encase the seeds, adding ornamental value. The plant is native to eastern Asia and features compound leaves with opposite arrangement. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the spring. The fruit is a bright orange-red capsule that matures in the fall, making it a visually appealing plant for gardens.
